definition: Fully committing to one's responsibilities, decisions, or words; not backing down.
unk_translation: Keeping your word; having integrity; walking the walk, not just talking the talk.
example_usage: He said he'd finish the project by Friday, and he did. He's really standing on business.

definition: To lose control, act recklessly, or engage in self-destructive behavior, often due to anger or frustration.
unk_translation: Flying off the handle; losing your cool; going postal; reckless abandonment.
example_usage: Don't crash out just because you didn't get the promotion. Stay composed.

definition: Over-complimenting or praising someone to the point of it being annoying or disingenuous; sucking up.
unk_translation: Brown-nosing; sucking up; being a teacher's pet; overly flattering.
example_usage: Stop glazing him just because he has a nice car.

definition: Having money, success, momentum, or things happening in your life.
unk_translation: Making moves; having irons in the fire; being a mover and shaker.
example_usage: Since he started that business, he's really having motion.

definition: In a bad situation; finished; doomed; exhausted.
unk_translation: Done for; toast; up a creek without a paddle.
example_usage: If I don't finish this report in an hour, I'm cooked.

definition: To focus intensely on a task or goal; to get serious.
unk_translation: Buckle down; put your nose to the grindstone; get in the zone.
example_usage: It's finals week, I need to lock in.

definition: Opposition; enemy; someone you have a conflict with.
example_usage: Keep your circle tight, don't let the opps know your next move.

definition: Lying / Not lying; telling the truth.
unk_translation: Baloney / Straight shooter; honest truth; word is bond.
example_usage: That story sounds like cap. / I saw it happen, no cap.

unk_translation: You got it; roger that; done deal; sounds good.

definition: Taking a portion of someone's food.
unk_translation: The 'dad tax' (eating your kids' fries); mooching a bite.
example_usage: He just took half my fries, calling it the Fanum tax.
